review_title: Company Has No Vision For Staff
job_title: Business Support Analyst in Knoxville, TN
pros: The industry is dragging them forward, but they are still years behind other health systems their size... but they are being forced to offer more flexibility and choices due to people leaving.
cons: Work/Life Balance, Good Ole Boy Environment, If you have ambition and are a hard worker be ready to be ridden like a work horse and eventually burnt out and thrown to the side for being a hard worker while those who do nothing are allowed to sit on the side lines and still get their annual merit pay.

pros: I enjoyed working closely with the patients, it was nice seeing their recovery. Most of the staff were kind and easy to work with.
cons: Sometimes we didn't get breaks on 12 hr shifts, had to rush to eat something just to keep going. Some managers, nurses, and other techs really show you and patients that they do not care about being there. Not a whole lot of empathy for their patients, and the patients really feel it. Some staff neglected patients needs or were just plain rude and aggressive towards them which put others in dangerous positions. Though we weren't supposed to, we were sometimes forced to be alone with 15-30 patients on units for maybe 10-15 mins, you just hope nothing happens until someone comes back to help you. I was hired to work on the kids unit, but I worked more on the Men's and Women's unit, I had to beg to work on the unit I was hired for. Could pay better, I stayed only because I enjoyed working with the patients. Peninsula could be a great place for patient recovery, but the way it is now, the patients and the staff deserve better.

job_title: Software Development Engineer in Knoxville, TN
pros: There is a lot of business units at Covenant that the IT department supports. There are opportunities to learn about a lot of different departments and the IT solutions they utilize. Covenant has over 10K employees, one of the largest employers in the area in an industry, healthcare, that has to continue to exist in the community.
cons: Covenant Health has been and never intends to be the pay leader in the market for any particular IT job. Because of this seventy to eighty percent of the IT staff are actually super-users who started in other department at Covenant and transfered into IT. Most staff in IT are capable of maintaining systems (build screens, setup users, etc) but are not able to resolve technical issues. Most staff technical capabilities start and end at confirming there is an issue, contacting the appropriate vendor, communicating status, and validating the fix once the vendor resolves the issue.

pros: The benefits are pretty good.
cons: The incentives for working overtime are not good enough.

pros: Good coworkers and state of the art equipment

pros:
I couldn't ask for better coworkers. Many of the people that I work with are among the highest caliber people that I have ever met.
I love the job itself (if not so much the organization), compensation/benefits are on par with similar roles in the area.
My own immediate manager (who is actually the assistant to the manager and is just filling the role because they fired the last manager over half a year ago and still haven't filled the position...), is competent and *seems* to understand the concerns of staff ...
cons:
... but said manager has little real power to effect change.

Breaks? What are breaks? Leadership? What leadership? The administration is always saying that they're here for us when we need them, that they're listening to our concerns, etc. and yet nothing ever changes, they're only ever seen when JCAHO or the state are around for an inspection, or to hassle nurses over seemingly trivial matters when there are glaring systemic problems remaining unaddressed (e.g., safe staffing ratios)

pros: kind nursing staff and caring doctors

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Knoxville, TN
pros: Job security, plenty of training
cons: short handed, need more employees

review_title: Avoids union rules by deceptive hiring practices
pros: Higher pay due to union contracts, accrual of time off is higher than average, union contract allows more flexibility in time off
cons: This facility hires people on a part-time basis then works you on a full-time basis from day one without ever changing your status.  Since the Affordable Care Act has nullified the unions contract regarding benefits for healthcare, the PT employees no longer qualify for health benefits.    In spite of the FT hours, employees remain classified as Part time so this facility completely avoids providing benefits to its employees in this fashion.  Additionally, this facility works in a chronic understaffed condition such that many employees do not get their breaks during the work day resulting in an 8 hour shift with zero break time.

pros:
There were a lot of nice people working here. Great healthcare benefits.  
Food truck options.
cons:
Bottom line-the pay scale is not where it should be-you work very hard with a lot of high expectations and the pay should be a minimum of at least $2 more per hour.     

The place needed new carpet about 10 years ago.

The bathrooms, seriously need music or a water feature noise maker.  There are a lot of people in them at all times, it's awkward.

A lot of training, too much for too long. There should be staggard training to add layers to your skills and knowledge. 

I think the coffee might be poison...seriously the worst coffee I've ever had. Undrinkable. I know it might be nice that it's provided, but if it's that gross just don't bother.

pros: Great reputation in the community. Competitive salary and benefits. Nice, clean, and modern facility. Delicious cafeteria.  Great doctors!
cons: Very poor human resources staff. No care to assist or help the employee. HR staff act as if you are a bother if you have genuine concerns. Will not return calls and ignore contact attempts.  Upper management not in touch with staff. Treat srmtaffas a number not people. Constant complaints from staff members about hours and work flow concerns. Poor patient care for outpatients in radiology in the evenings.

review_title: Poor management;  rampant nepotism;  good ole boy environment.
pros: Work for Covenant Health if you need a job but don't depend on 1) advancement , 2) effective management, 3) interest in your career goals, 4) mutual respect, or 5) acceptance of diverse workforce.
cons: Rampant nepotism; unqualified middle-management (no leadership skills); demeaning and non-trusting attitude towards employees, (cameras with fish-eyed lenses and face-recognition capabilities throughout office areas - web-based camera feeds are viewable by anyone with the password); guidelines and rules are different depending on who you know or who you are related to; cliques; hard-work not recognized; 1% annual raises.  Work this job while you are looking for a better one where people are mutually respectful and work together.

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Great benefits, great CTO/vacation policy, some departments within the business office have very flexible time, but that depends on who the manager is.
cons: Training isn't consistent since there are no set training methods. You are just placed to shadow someone and your success really depends on how well your training goes. The worst part though is that the place is like high school. One of the supervisors acts like the ring leader,  and if you are part of her posse, you will get the special treatment, special projects, special attention and awards, etc. HR knows about this favoritism, but does nothing about it.

review_title: worked for 3 hospitals within the system. All have poor management hiring system
pros: Good name recognition.  Pay is decent
cons: Prefer to hire less direct care staff to meet their bottom line.  Management is hardly even visible because they are constantly in meetings. Therefore they know nothing about staffing shortages or other problems.  They probably don't care.

pros: Having insurance so I can manage the chronic conditions that develop caused by stress from this job.
cons: Pay is horrible, nurses are rude and don’t help, management doesn’t change anything. See more below.

review_title: Great benefits but many disengaged employees and horrible pay
pros: Covenant Health provided excellent benefits, especially health insurance.  If you had a procedure done at one of the Covenant owned facilities there was no out of pocket cost or a deductible that had to be met. The paid time off (PTO) was incredibly generous as you let it accumulate without penalty and the company pays you your PTO when you leave.
cons: The pay is horrible unless you are in senior management.  The senior management has very little regard to employees as the employee is deemed replaceable.  There is no upward mobility as most job movement is lateral.  Executives receive a nice bonus structure while many of the employees struggle. Many of the top positions are filled with outside people.  There is no organic growth.

job_title: CT Technologist in Lenoir City, TN
pros: Not constant work. Some down time.
cons: Appears very charming But some stay because they must...

review_title: Need physician  liaison between management and physician
pros: Good benefits. Large system
cons: Management out of touch with physician practices at the ground level. There is no physician liaison with management. Management hands down directives in a disorganized way in a manner that lacks vision and direction. There is no clear manner in which management seeks to understand how to reduce the burden of the EMR on physicians. The only docs to get scribes work in the ER and I do not think they are even Covenant employees.

review_title: read between the lines-not all policies apply
pros: most of your co-workers are genuinely good people. pay scale can be satisfactory. physician and nursing staff are well-educated. medical staff has great ability to move around within the company. you won't get canned when you near retirement age.
cons: some co-workers will take advantage if they have a position of authority. pay scale is typically low. employees who have worked there a long time may less educated than newer, lower-paid employees; be careful-you could get stuck in a dead-end job.

review_title: Overall a good place to work
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Competitive salary and benefits.  They match up to 6% of your 401K contributions which is more than most in the area.   Career opportunities in that jobs are posted internally before they are sent to the outside, and since it is such a large conglomerate of health care services, there are plenty of opportunities.
cons: It is such a large company, I have never felt the Human Resources department has the individual employees best interests in mind.  It is more of a "politically correct" attitude and what is best for the company as a whole.  While understandable, it is frustrating and disappointing when an employee has an issue.

review_title: Decent but there’s better out there
pros: You can have as much overtime as long as it’s there. Not so much micromanaged on late shifts. Decent schedule
cons: Being stuck on the same schedule without a change. Being told what you have done wrong without positives. Pay is low unless you work late shifts. No uniforms were given, when they require you to wear a certain polo shirt. Nurses and other staff members are rude that aren’t in the department.

pros: Great co-workers and a good place to start a career if you don't know any better.
cons: They blaze in and take over, firing anyone with any relationships established outside the Covenant System. For patients it's like Hotel California. Once you check in, you can't check out. They tell you who you can/can't use for health care. They don't give patients any choices at all. They make a point to bring in outside employees and find small reasons to fire anyone who makes more money than they want to pay or anyone with family working for other organizations. They hire cheap, inexperienced nurses and doctors. It's all about the dime.

pros: Job security- there is no fear of layoff. Good benefits: medical /dental /life insurance,401k,CTO,cafeteria discount. Many optional choices - life,  long term disability, vision,etc.
cons: High turnover in nursing. Requires continuous new staff orientation and training. Need more concentration on staff retention.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Knoxville, TN
pros:
Great opportunities for advancement while furthering your education. Best hospital system in East Tennessee. Managers work hard to give you a flexible schedule. great health insurance benefits
8 hours paid time off each pay period (2 weeks)
Great place to start but if you needed an increase in pay, it's better to leave and get rehired.
cons:
1% annual pay increase
inconsistent management
minimal cafeteria discount
being called everyday you're not working to come into work
high patient load
inadequate increases in pay, especially for long time employees.

pros: Great place to learn and get your feet wet before graduating a nursing program. Nurses seem to be happy in most departments.
cons: Current CNAs aren't always willing to help you orient to floors. Certain floors seem understaffed and not happy, however, most area hospitals are this way. Parkwest seems to have the happiest employees. I only give them one star in compensation and benefits due to the low pay for nurses in the area. TN and this area specifically severely under pay their nurses when compared to national averages for new grads!

job_title: Patient Account Representative II in Knoxville, TN
pros:
Daytime Hours
Easy to learn Job
cons:
Lack of communication on for ever changing policies.
High Benefit Prices.

review_title: I worked at MMC in Oak Ridge for 1 1/2 years.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: It is small enough that there is still a family feeling among the staff. Ancillary services cooperate with nursing services to meet the needs of the patients. The union makes sure that staff are treated fairly as much as possible.
cons: Administration/upper management have lost sight of the importance of caring for patients. Middle management cannot perform their duties properly due to meetings and implementing "quick fix schemes".

review_title: Great people, not so great management
pros: We are a family, and we take care of each other. There is always an opportunity to learn something new. The doctors are great, too.
cons: The folks in management don't seem to be focused on the right areas. We have to play defense with them. We are understaffed (Like many healthcare facilities).

review_title: Uncomfortable first few years with Covenant. Much better after facility transfer into hospital setting.
pros: Fellow employees are generally caring, reliable and great people to work with. Company appears to be stable, with no fear of impending job losses.
cons: Management skills of some in leadership positions is questionable. Equipment is sometimes dated and well-used. Salary is below norm and does not adequately reflect higher educational levels.

review_title: Pleasant experience as a brief employee in medical records department.
job_title: Medical Records Employee in Lenoir City, TN
pros: Good work flow. Nice, well kept facility. Supervisors were fair and friendly. Pay was fairly good considering I was a staffing solution employee.
cons: I wasn't there long enough to form any bad opinions. I wish they would have kept me longer than they did a massive layoff towards the end of the year and all the new employees were cut first. I really enjoyed the work and got along great with everyone.

pros: The team is wonderful, very helpful and caring. I couldn't ask for a better group of people to work with. Pay is good, comparable to my last position.
cons: Occasionally understaffed both with nurses and techs. It's not a constant thing, just occasionally. Other than that, no other complaints.

pros: Excellent insurance, write-off copays & deductibles @ sister hospitals.  Good staff & doctors to work with.
cons: Morale in toilet, raise freeze for 3+ years. No back up from management, management are all "company men", even if staff is in the right. Staff expected to believe in company 1st, family 2nd; there's no such thing as a personal life - you should always choose work.

pros: Stable company.  Great co-workers.  Feedback welcomed related to process improvement.  A great place to make a difference in our community.
cons: Large company sometimes slow to adapt changes.  Continue to have difficulty working as a "health system" at times.  Do not always understand the power of one.

pros: The friendly atmosphere and the ability to continuously learn and grow is what drew me to Roane Medical.  It has a true sense of family and the benefits are amazing!
cons: Facility is a smaller facility so if you like the hustle and bustle of large hospitals, this may not be for you.  Everyone here knows each other and work well as a team for the best patient experience possible.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Great Coworkers, fun atmosphere, flexible when time needed off,
cons: Management does not follow up when things need replaced or repaired, little support from management overall, seasoned employees are not held to the same standard as new employees. No PTO-sick days for Part time employees, Health insurance premiums for part-time employees are unreasonable, Equipment is outdated and falling apart,

review_title: Good place to work, great people but the company is extremely slow at making decisions.
pros: Pay, people, benefits. friendly and care of patients.
cons: Most times the left hand does not know what the right hand is doing.  Lots of promises that never come true.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Good Benefit package and study pay.
cons: Constantly short staff. Micromanaging from supervisors. Volume of work versus employees is unrealistic.  Management continually change expectations.  Management/supervisors boarder on harassment and even bullying staff. Little to no training.

pros: Great co workers, decent health insurance, 8 hours CTO every two weeks.
cons:
Always dangerously short staffed 
No holiday pay unless you are PRN staff
Cannot move to other departments, they hire from outside rather than move you to another floor 
Workload is ridiculous

pros: Insurance and CTO benefits are good. You meet new people and get to care for them.
cons: LPNs are treated like dirt. Starting pay is $11.78! We get used as CNAs while the RNs don’t. We’re sent to a nursing home to work(RNs are not)when we’ve never been trained or met the patients but we’re expected to pass meds and care for them. We staff the nursing home even though our med-surg  floor is already short staffed and drowning.

review_title: Rewarding work, difficult to maintain personal life
pros: Flexibility with scheduling; lots of opportunities to give feedback or to obtain continued learning resources; help is given when asked (if available)
cons: No consistent follow up from management when suggesting ideas for improvement in processes; Poor communication between staff; nurses documentation is minimal and doesn't always contain important information; No consistency in patient care - many patients get a different nurse every day which is not ideal in the hospice field.

pros: Everyone I worked with was a blessing. I really liked the culture at the different sites.
cons: Many of the managers/ executives ignore individuals who are trying to make a difference. You have to continuously recruit better and promote others from within. This will make the company stronger in the long run. Compensation is also lacking compared to others in the industry.

pros: Benefits. they have pleanty of goodies to offset the salary that you will recieve. There is pleanty of opertunities for education.
cons: Management is very good at keeping you in the dark, a whole lot of secrecy in operations and will not go to bat for you.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Good benefits if you ever have to be admitted to a covenant hospital!
cons: Worst thing of all is all time off, even holidays when the office is closed, comes out of "combined time off" or "CTO"! Takes forever to accrue any time worth anything & heaven forbid if you get sick!!! Then if your time falls below 32 hours 3 times in a quarter they'll strip you of your benefits (even if it's because of holidays & office being closed & you had no cto accrued!!) sucks that you have to pay for uour own holiday pay!!

pros: Rarely ever any OT. Satisfaction assisting patients whether administratively speaking or  clinically speaking.
cons: Have to earn your PTO. Pay is subpar. Develop a good relationship with your superior in order to move around or  move up in Covenant.

review_title: This was the worst place I have ever worked and would NEVER recommend for employment or healthcare
pros: Felt safe as far as security. That's about it. The security guys were nice but the one on the weekend was constantly talking to the nurses and flirting. He was never, ever in his office but could easily be found at any nurses station.
cons: Management bullying, low pay, discrimination, dirty, not clean. No raises, no advancement, men get vacation, women told no. Write ups, threats of repercussions, retaliations and lots of lies to keep you in line. Won't hire help but push until physical limit is met to do workload of 3,4 plus people. Having to make up for the shortfall they caused by firing and basically forcing people beyond physical means to perform unrealistic workloads. This place is just a glorified sweat shop. Covenant made the situation worse not better. The previous review was very accurate in saying that it's a good ol boys thing going on because the men sat in break rooms and sneaked around watching tv and going to their hiding places while the women were metaphorically "slave beaten" to finish and get all the work done while men sat in supervisors office with the supervisor in air conditioned office while we ran to the time clock to clock out not a minute late or we would have to clock in early the next day to make that minute up. Never ever given an encouraging word or compliment from management. I have personally worked through my breaks and sometimes half through my supper to get my work done so I wouldn't get a write up. And I'm not talking about a couple I mean both breaks at times and for weeks at a time. I was never late, sick, left early, missed a day, had no write ups and was denied a day off. I was taught if you were a hard and responsible worker, it would pay off. Not here. The lazy ones are the ones who get catered too. May God have mercy on your soul if you ever work or have the misfortune of being a patient there.  If there was a choice lower than very dissatisfied on the question part, I would choose that. This place is filthy and falling down. Water leaking in through roofs, into the surgery area and having to be pumped out with machines. It's a decayed, dilapidated building with bugs.

pros:
Decent pay
Schedule flexibility 
They will pay for your certification
cons: Serious lack of communication between management and employees. VERY short staffed. This department can not keep employees to properly cover the needs of the surgery department. “Make up as they go” rules and policies.

review_title: Always wondered  the meaning behind the  "Shame on Covenant Health" signs - wouldnt want to be a patient
pros: great co-workers - this place used to be a great place to work
cons: They hire alot of family which means - if they want your hours, they get them.  Watch your paycheck and your vacation hours - they seem to come up short.  They like to hire students at less money and keep a few seniors to pick up the slack.

pros: The people are great to work with and the environment is always very well kept up and clean.
cons: They strive to pay their employees less than average because they feel the culture and environment are enough to keep them.

pros:
Smaller hospital setting, made it easy to quickly familarize with ancillary staff
Close to home (short drive)
Newer facility
cons:
Poor communication between departments (ED to Med/Surge, Med/Surge to ICU, etc)
Pharmacy with limited hours, hard to access after hours and weekends
Large population of drug seeking patients

job_title: One of Many Exteriorly Hired Personell in Knoxville, TN
pros: If you know someone personally, it is  easy to get a job. Otherwise, its difficult.
cons: Management does the "secret squirrel" thing where they keep all the employees in the dark until someone leeks. This, coupled with lower than average pay, causes a huge turnover; especially when the management create issues from nothing and cant work with staff. A very "them vs. us" environment.

pros: Friendly staff, updated equipment.
cons:
Most physicians don't respond well to suggestions regarding patients. Low salaries.  Very short staffed constantly. Overtime is expected "for the team".
Get rid of the pagers for updated communication between departments

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Great co-workers and decent benefits
cons: New director definitely does not put the patient first, which is part of our pledge. He has stated publicly that only applies in the hospitals when the patient is being treated,  not when it comes to billing and collections.

review_title: 10 applications to transfer and stood up at my only interview
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Knoxville, TN
pros: Nice facilities, good benefits, occasional free food
cons: Short staffed, no advancement opportunities, poor management, poor workplace culture, limited parking, low pay, once you're hired you're stuck where you are

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Good Union pay and benefits.  Great coworkers. Pretty good schedules. Plenty of overtime if you want it. Great credit union for employees
cons: Managers are constantly on witch-hunts to discipline employees. Always trying to skirt contractual rules. Mandatory shifts and never ending short staffing

review_title: They didn't listen to their employees.
pros: The benefits were good. Pay was comparable to other hospitals in the area. I liked my patients and most of my job duties.
cons: Management did not listen to their employees needs or concerns for patient care. It was difficult to speak to anyone above you about any problems.

pros: Benefits are some of the best.  Salary is reasonable. Large growing company.
cons: PRN staff are required to work at least 72 hours a quarter but still do not receive benefits.

review_title: I have gained a lot of knowledge & experience from the 2 years I've been here.
pros: Night shift nurses work together & help each other
cons:
Only one hospitalist at night & not familiar with patient
Too many new grads
Mixing own IV drips at night

pros: If you use one of their doctors most time there is no charge.  Benefits are good.  Kept busy at all times and a easy work environment.
cons: Not enough work advances and lack of Professionalism.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Knoxville, TN
pros: Following employment you will be more than capable of writing a season of American Horror Story
cons: Manipulative,  deceitful, unskilled  management.  This hospital is know to promote and retain their own homegrown robots. Low skill level, high self importance. Low raises (if at all) Unsafe hostile working environment.

pros: I absolutely loved my job at Fort Sanders. I learned a lot of material used throughout the whole hospital. 1900+ materials. And loved being on the go non stop.
cons: No downsides to this job at all.

review_title: Wonderful company to work for - great work atmosphere!
pros: Covenant truly cares about its employees. They are very good about promoting from within the company and offer a GREAT benefit plan.
cons: Pay is not very competitive with other healthcare systems in the surrounding area; yearly pay increases are minimal.

review_title: Nurses and Doctors are destroying salaries for those that actually care
job_title: Materials Management in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Health Insurance prices and plans are pretty good
cons: Worst Job ever can't believe I was there so long

job_title: RN, Bsn in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Great communication among staff and management.  I have been employed here for over 5 years and as long as you do your job and take care of your patients as you should it is great!
cons: None really personal preference, I have never had any issues.

review_title: Great for a while but they will can you in a minute with no warning.

cons: Your life is there life

review_title: Just looking to turn over good employees. :(
job_title: Phlebotomist Senior Lab Assistant in Crossville, TN
pros: None, other then human resources are very sweet, they do not support you or help you in your role. But they are pleasantly nice.  Allot of great people work here.
cons: If you are educated and licensed, do not apply. If you are good at your job and you are well liked you will not last long. They will get rid of you in a heartbeat. So very sad. Very low pay.

pros: Friendly coworkers, over time available, try's to work with schedules
cons: Where to start? Poorly managed, low pay, management doesn't care to tell you what you want to hear, over work, mandatory overtime, people always quitting, never enough staff, will do the work of 2 people, LOW PAY, for a 50-100 million dollar company they pay their employees less than other hospitals.

review_title: Poor pay and not enough help

cons: Pay scale for RT's is pathetic and the patient load is way more than one person can do efficiently and the proper amount of time cannot be given to each patient because of this.

review_title: You couldn't pay me to work there again.

pros: Always have excellent patient care given

pros: Employee Benefits packages, retirement and local discounts

pros: Great health insurance, 401k with match
